sen.j: JR京都線（ジェイアールきょうとせん）は、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）東海道本線の京都駅～大阪駅間の愛称である。
sen.e: "JR Kyoto-sen" (JR Kyoto Line) is the nickname for the section between Kyoto Station and Osaka Station on the Tokaido Main Line of West Japan Railway (JR West).
"JR Kyoto-sen" (JR Kyoto Line) is the nickname for the section between Kyoto Station and Osaka Station on the Tokaido Main Line of West Japan Railway (JR West).
JR Kyoto-sen (JR Kyoto Line) is the unofficial name given to the section of the Tokaido Main Line of the West Japan Railway (JR West) that runs between Kyoto Station and Osaka Station.
sen.cmt: The information in this sentence could easily be rearranged to read more naturally.

sen.j: この愛称は1988年3月13日から使用されている。
sen.e: This nickname has been used since March 13, 1988.
This nickname has been used since March 13, 1988.
This name has been used since March 13, 1988.
sen.cmt: nicknameを単にnameに修正しました。

sen.j: ほぼ全区間阪急電鉄の阪急京都本線（京都線）と並行し、近畿日本鉄道にも近鉄京都線があって、それぞれ大阪（梅田）駅、京都駅で接続しているため、混同を避けるために愛称に「JR」と付けている。
sen.e: While in almost all the section, the Hankyu Kyoto Line of Hankyu Corporation goes in parallel, Kintetsu Corporation operates a line named Kintetsu Kyoto Line, and in addition, as each of these lines connects with the JR Kyoto Line at Osaka (Umeda) Station and Kyoto Station, respectively, "JR" is prefixed to the nickname to avoid confusions.
sen.cmt: 阪急電鉄：http://rail.hankyu.co.jp/en、近畿日本鉄道:HP(www.kintetsu.jp/)、京都駅でJR京都線と接続しているため→connected with JR Kyoto Line at … and Kyoto Station を加えました。
sen.e: While in nearly all the section the Hankyu Kyoto Line of Hankyu Corporation runs in parallel, Kintetsu Corporation operates a line called the Kintetsu Kyoto Line, and in addition, since each of these lines connects with the JR Kyoto Line at Osaka (Umeda) Station and Kyoto Station, respectively, "JR" is prefixed to the nickname to avoid confusion.

The prefix "JR" had to be added to "Kyoto Line" in this unofficial name to prevent confusion as this line connects with the Hankyu Kyoto Line, operated by the Hankyu Corporation (nearly all of which runs in parallel with the JR Kyoto Line), at Osaka (Umeda) Station and the Kintetsu Kyoto Line, operated by the Kintetsu Corporation, at Kyoto Station.
sen.cmt: This sentence needed to be completely rewritten as it made no sense. This seems to have been a very chokuyaku attempt at translation with little thought given to the overall context. For example, the reader would probably assume from "While in nearly all the section the Hankyu Kyoto Line of Hankyu Corporation runs in parallel,..." that individual sections of the Hankyu Kyoto Line run in parallel to each other. If my understanding is correct, however, what the Japanese is actually saying is that this line runs in parallel with the JR Kyoto Line for the most part.

sen.j: ラインカラーは青（■）であり、JR神戸線ともども同社のメインラインという位置づけから、コーポレートカラー自体がそのままラインカラーとして充てられている。
sen.e: The line is color-coded in blue（■）, because together with the JR Kobe Line, it is considered as a main line of the company and therefore the corporate color itself is applied.
The line is color-coded in blue（■) because, together with the JR Kobe Line, it is considered as a main line of the company and therefore the corporate color is applied.
Together with the JR Kobe Line, this line is considered to be one of the company's main lines so it is color-coded in blue, which is the company's corporate color.
sen.cmt: The use of commas here is fine (they are being used to indicate a non-defining relative clause), but I have rewritten the sentence to make it read more naturally.（■)を削除

tit.cmt: 奈良線と合わせました。

sen.j: 東海道新幹線・阪急京都本線に並行して淀川右岸を走り、京都～大阪間42.8kmを新快速が最短28分で結んでいる（最高速度は130km/h）。
sen.e: The line runs on the right bank of the Yodo-gawa River in parallel with the Tokaido Shinkansen and the Hankyu Kyoto Line, and the Special Rapid connects the distance of 42.8km between Kyoto and Osaka in 28 minutes in the shortest time (maximum speed reaches 130km/h).

The line runs on the right bank of the Yodo-gawa River in parallel with the Tokaido Shinkansen and the Hankyu Kyoto Line, and the Special Rapid connects the distance of 42.8km between Kyoto and Osaka in 28 minutes in the shortest time (at a maximum speed of 130km/h).

The line runs on the right bank of the Yodo-gawa River in parallel with the Tokaido Shinkansen and the Hankyu Kyoto Line, and the special rapid connects the distance of 42.8 km between Kyoto and Osaka in 28 minutes in the shortest time (at a maximum speed of 130 km/h).
sen.cmt: special rapidとしました（小文字に）。

sen.j: 全区間複々線方向別複々線（外側線・内側線）である。
sen.e: All the section has a quadruple track in each direction (outbound line as well as inbound line).
sen.cmt: 外側線・内側線→定訳不明：outbound line, inbound lineとしました。英辞郎on the WEB参照。
sen.e: The entire section has a quadruple track in each direction (outbound and inbound lines).
The entire section has a quadruple track in each direction (outer and inner lines).
sen.cmt: 内側線→inner line 外側線→outer line

sen.j: JR京都線の全ての駅でJスルー・ICOCA、及び東日本旅客鉄道（JR東日本）のSuica、東海旅客鉄道（JR東海）のTOICA、またスルッとKANSAIのPiTaPaが使用できる。
sen.e: J-THRU/ICOCA, Suica of the East Japan Railway Company (JR East) and TOICA of the Central Japan Railway Company (JR Central), as well as, KANSAI THRU PASS, PiTaPa can be used at all of stations of JR Kyoto Line.
sen.cmt: Jsuru-/ICOCA→定訳不明：J-THRU ICOCA、スルッとKANSAIのPiTaPa→KANSAI THRU PASS, PiTaPa (http://www.surutto.com/main/photo/english/eng_jpnkind1.htm
sen.e: J-THRU/ICOCA, Suica of the East Japan Railway Company (JR East) and TOICA of the Central Japan Railway Company (JR Central), as well as, KANSAI THRU PASS and PiTaPa can be used at all stations on the JR Kyoto Line.

J-THRU/ICOCA, Suica of the East Japan Railway Company (JR East) and TOICA of the Central Japan Railway Company (JR Central), as well as PiTaPa of KANSAI THRU PASS, can be used at all stations on the JR Kyoto Line.

sen.j: 全線で阪和線運行管理システムが導入されている。
sen.e: The Hanwa Line's train operation management system is introduced in all the line.
The Hanwa Line's train operation management system has been introduced throughout the line.
The Hanwa Line's train operation management system has been introduced throughout the line.

sen.j: JR神戸線や琵琶湖線と一体的に運行されている。
sen.e: It is operated in an integrated manner with the JR Kobe Line and the Biwako Line.
sen.cmt: JR神戸線、琵琶湖線：用語リスト＃1353参照
sen.e: It operates integrally with the JR Kob Line and the Biwako Line.
It is operated integrally with the JR Kobe Line and the Biwako Line.

sen.j: JR神戸線・琵琶湖線に直通する新快速・快速列車・普通列車（京阪神緩行線）の各列車のほか、北陸地方・関西国際空港・山陰地方方面などへの特別急行列車も走る。
sen.e: Not only the new rapid trains, rapid trains, and local trains (Keihanshin Kankosen), which are directly connected to the Kobe Line and the Biwako Line, but also the limited express trains bound for the Hokuriku District, Kansai International Airport, or the Sanin District, etc. run on the line.
sen.cmt: 新快速・快速列車・普通列車（京阪神緩行線）：用語リスト#1353参照
sen.e: Not only the new rapid trains, rapid trains and local trains (Keihanshin Kankosen), which are directly connected to the Kobe and Biwako lines, but also the limited express trains bound for the Hokuriku District, Kansai International Airport, or the Sanin District, etc., run on the line.

Not only the special rapids, rapid services and local trains (Keihanshin Kankosen), which are directly connected to the JR Kobe and Biwako lines, but also the limited express trains bound for the Hokuriku District, Kansai International Airport, or the Sanin District, etc., run on the line.
sen.cmt: 新快速の訳修正 JR神戸線のJR追加 Sanin としました。

sen.j: また、普通列車の半分近くが福知山線新三田駅まで乗り入れる。
sen.e: Nearly half of the Local trains share the same track with the Fukuchiyama line to Shin-Sanda Station.
sen.cmt: 福知山線新三田駅：用語リスト1353ではFukuchiyama Line Sanda Station (Shin無し）となっていました。
sen.e: Nearly half of the local trains share the same track with the Fukuchiyama Line to Shin-Sanda Station.
Nearly half of the local trains share the same track with the Fukuchiyama Line to Shin-Sanda Station.

tit.cmt: 優等列車→定訳不明：higher category trainとしました。 (各駅停車以上の設備やスピードを提供する列車の日本語総称のようです）。

sen.j: JR化後に新大阪発着であった九州への寝台特急や、天王寺始発だった南紀方面の特急、また智頭急行開業で運行を開始した山陰への「はくと (列車)」などが新たに京都まで直通運転されるようになり、この区間の特急の列車本数は飛躍的に増えた。
sen.e: After the privatization to JR, many trains as follows started going through to Kyoto Station: the limited express with sleeping berths bound for Kyushu, which was departing from and arriving at Shin Osaka, the limited express starting from Tennouji Station for Minamikishu, and the limited express "Hakuto", which started the operation with the establishment of Chizu Express Co., Ltd., and in consequence, the number of the trains running in this section increased drastically.
sen.cmt: 寝台特急→定訳不明： limited express with sleeping berths （英辞郎 on the WEB参)
sen.e: With the privatization to JR, many trains as follows started going through to Kyoto Station: the limited express with sleeping berths bound for Kyushu, which was departing from and arriving at Shin Osaka; the limited express starting from Tennouji Station for Minamikishu; and the Limited Express "Hakuto," which started operation with the establishment of Chizu Express Co., Ltd., thus generating a dramatic increase in the number of trains running in this section.

With the privatization to JR, many trains (as follows) started going through to Kyoto Station: the overnight train service bound for Kyushu, which was departing from and arriving at Shin-Osaka; the limited express starting from Tennoji Station for Nanki; and the limited express 'Hakuto,' bound for Sanin district, which started operation with the establishment of Chizu Express Co., Ltd., thus generating a dramatic increase in the number of trains running in this section.
sen.cmt: 寝台特急をovernight train service （用語リスト#1353), 新大阪をShin-Osakaとしました。「山陰への」を追加しました。 Minamikishu をNankiとしました。括弧修正Sanin としました。

sen.j: 特に関西空港開港と同時に運転を開始したはるか (列車)は、その1年後にはすべての列車が京都まで定期列車で入るようになり、新大阪～京都は北陸方面のエル特急「雷鳥 (列車)」など他の列車と合わせ時間4本程度運転される特急街道になっている。
sen.e: Especially, Airport Express "Haruka", which began its operation with the inauguration of the Kansai International Airport, started an exclusive operation at regular basis in one year, and the section between Shin Osaka and Kyoto has become a "limited express highway", where together with other trains such as Limited Express "Raicho" bound for Hokuriku District, around four (4) limited trains run every hour.
sen.cmt: はるか（列車）→Airport Express "Haruka"(用語リスト#1353)、特急街道→定訳不明：limited express highway
sen.e: Particularly, the airport express "Haruka," which began operating with the inauguration of Kansai International Airport, reached exclusive operation on a regular basis within one year, and the section between Shin Osaka and Kyoto has become a "limited express highway" where, together with other trains such as the limited express "Raicho" bound for the Hokuriku District, about four limited trains run every hour.

Particularly, the airport express 'Haruka,' which began operating with the inauguration of Kansai International Airport, started going through to Kyoto on a regular basis within one year, and the section between Shin-Osaka and Kyoto has become a limited express highway where, together with other trains such as the limited express 'Raicho' bound for the Hokuriku District, about four limited trains run every hour.
sen.cmt: 新大阪をShin-Osakaとしました。「京都まで」を追加しました。括弧修正

sen.j: なお、京都発着の九州への寝台特急は2008年3月15日のダイヤ改正で全廃された。
sen.e: On the other hand, the limited express with sleeping berths for Kyushu, which departed from and arrived at Kyoto, was completely abolished when the timetable was revised on March 15, 2008.
sen.cmt: 寝台特急→定訳不明：limited express with sleeping berths（英辞郎 on the WEB 参照）。
sen.e: On the other hand, the limited express with sleeping berths for Kyushu, which departed from and arrived at Kyoto, was completely abolished when the timetable was revised on March 15, 2008.
On the other hand, the overnight express service for Kyushu, which departed from and arrived at Kyoto, was completely abolished when the timetable was revised on March 15, 2008.
sen.cmt: Writing "overnight express train service" would be a bit long so, as it's clear from the context that we are talking about a train service, I have shortened it to "overnight express service".

sen.j: なお、新大阪から大阪環状線を通りで阪和線に入る下りの特急「はるか」や「くろしお (列車)」は、茨木駅構内（第3出発）から貨物線に入り、吹田信号場経由で新大阪に入る。
sen.e: Besides, the limited express trains starting from Shin Osaka and entering to the Hanwa Line through the Osaka Trunk Line, such as Limited Express "Haruka" and "Kuroshio", go into the freight line at the Ibaraki Station Yard and proceed to Shin Osaka Station via Suita Signal Ground.
sen.cmt: 貨物線→定訳不明：freight line (用語リスト#1353参照）、吹田信号場→定訳不明：Suita Signal Ground,なお、吹田信号所（たとえば176,180,183行目）という表記も同じ訳にしました。
sen.e: Moreover, the limited express trains starting from Shin Osaka and entering to the Hanwa Line through the Osaka Trunk Line, such as the limited express trains "Haruka" and "Kuroshio," enter the freight line at the Ibaraki Station Yard and proceed to Shin Osaka Station via Suita Signal Ground.

Moreover, the outbound limited express trains starting from Shin-Osaka and entering to the Hanwa Line through the Osaka loop Line, such as the airport express 'Haruka' and limited express 'Kuroshio,' enter the freight line at the Ibaraki Station Yard (departure number 3) and proceed to Shin-Osaka Station via Suita signal station.
sen.cmt: 新大阪をShin-Osakaとしました。 「第3出発」を (departure number 3)としました→定訳不明 吹田信号場 → Suita Signal Station としました.。 下り→outbound

sen.j: そのため、同区間を外側線で走る特急や新快速より若干所要時間が余計にかかり、時間帯によっては新大阪で特急列車が2本同時に進入することもある。
sen.e: That is why it takes a little more time than the limited express or special rapid trains running on the outbound line of the same section, and in a certain time slot, two limited express trains proceed into the tracks at the same time at Shin Osaka Station.
sen.cmt: 外側線→定訳不明：outbound line (英辞郎 on the WEB 参照）
sen.e: That is why it takes a little more time than the limited express or special rapid trains running on the outbound line of the same section, and in a certain time slot two limited express trains proceed onto the tracks at the same time at Shin Osaka Station.

That is why it takes a little more time than the limited express or special rapids running on the outer line of the same section, and in a certain time slot two limited express trains proceed onto the tracks at the same time at Shin-Osaka Station.
sen.cmt: 新大阪をShin-Osakaとしました。 新快速をSpecial Rapidとしました。 外側線→outer line

sen.j: 京都～大阪のほぼ全線にわたり線形は極めてよく、外側線は一部の曲線区間を除いて130km/h運転が可能である。
sen.e: In almost all the section between Kyoto and Osaka, the line has an extremely good lineation which permits the train run at 130km/h in the outbound line except some sections with curves.
sen.cmt: 線形→定訳不明：lineation、外側線→定訳不明：outbound line (英辞郎 on the WEB 参照）
sen.e: Over nearly the entire section between Kyoto and Osaka, the line has extremely good lineation that permits the train to run at 130km/h in the outbound line, except for some curved sections.
Over nearly the entire section between Kyoto and Osaka, the line has extremely good lineation that permits the train to run at 130 km/h in the outer line, except for some curved sections.

sen.j: 内側線も120km/h対応しているが、優等列車が内側を走ることはない（回送や臨時列車にはある）。
sen.e: The inbound line also permit the trains run at 120km/h, but higher category trains don't use the inner side (except deadheadｓ or special trains).
sen.cmt: 内側線→定訳不明：inbound line (英辞郎 on the WEB参照）、優等列車→定訳不明：higher category train (各駅停車local trainに対応させて）としました、回送車→deadhead（小学館プログレッシブ）、臨時列車→ special trains（小学館プログレッシブ）
sen.e: The inbound line also permits the trains to run at 120km/h, but higher-category trains don't use the inner side (except deadheads or special trains).
The inner line also permits the trains to run at 120 km/h, but higher-category trains don't use the inner line (except deadheads or special trains).

sen.j: この区間を走行する優等列車は以下の通り。
sen.e: The followings are the higher category trains running in the section.
sen.cmt: 優等列車→定訳不明：higher categoryl train (各駅停車local trainに対応させて）としました。
sen.e: The following are the higher-category trains running on the section.
The following are the higher-category trains that run on this section of the line.
sen.cmt: Regardless of whether "following" is followed by a singular verb or a plural verb, it never becomes "followings". This would be grammatically incorrect.

sen.e: In June, 1996, some of the rapid trains, which were passing through between Kyoto Station and Takatsuki Station during a nonstop time slot, began making a stop at Kotari Station (current Nagaoka Station).
sen.cmt: 通過時間帯→定訳不明：a nonstop time slotとしました。
sen.e: In June 1996, some of the rapid trains, which were passing through between Kyoto Station and Takatsuki Station during the nonstop time slot, began making stops at Kotari Station (currently Nagaoka Station).

June 1995: Some of the rapid service trains, which passed through between Kyoto Station and Takatsuki Station during the nonstop time slot, began making stops at Kotari Station (currently Nagaokakyo Station).

sen.j: 1995年（平成7年）9月、平日の快速が長岡京駅に終日停車。
sen.e: In September, 1995, the rapid trains began making a stop at Nagaoka Station throughout the day, during weekdays.

sen.j: 1996年（平成8年）3月、すべての快速が長岡京駅に停車。
sen.e: In March, 1996, all rapid trains began making a stop at Nagaoka Station.

sen.j: 2004年（平成16年）10月、113系の定期運用撤退。
sen.e: In October, 2004, regular operation of Train Series 113 was withdrawn.

sen.j: 1972年3月15日の新幹線岡山開業に伴うダイヤ改正で、昼間15分パターンのダイヤが生まれた。
sen.e: When Shinkansen Okayama Station started the operation on March 15, 1972, the timetable was revised, and a new timetable with an 15 minutes' interval pattern during the daytime was made.
sen.cmt: 15分パターンのダイヤ→ new timetable with an 15 minutes' interval としました。
sen.e: When Shinkansen Okayama Station started operation on March 15, 1972, the timetable was revised and a new timetable with a 15-minute daytime interval pattern was made.
When Shinkansen Okayama Station started operation on March 15, 1972, the timetable was revised and a new timetable with a 15-minute daytime interval pattern was made.

sen.j: 大阪駅上りを例にすると、新快速・快速（大阪で新快速待避）・普通（甲子園口→京都）・普通（西明石→吹田）と発車する。
sen.e: For example, the up trains from Osaka Station depart in the following order: Special Rapid, Rapid (letting the connecting Special Rapid pass at Osaka Station), Local Train (from Koshienguchi Station to Kyoto Station), Local Train (from Nishi-Akashi Station to Kyoto Station).
sen.cmt: 上り→up train (小学館プ）、新快速待避→定訳不明：letting the connecting Special Rapid passとしました。
sen.e: For example, the up trains from Osaka Station depart in the following order: Special Rapid, Rapid (letting the connecting Special Rapid pass at Osaka Station) and Local Train (from Koshienguchi Station to Kyoto Station), Local Train (from Nishi-Akashi Station to Kyoto Station).

For example, the inbound trains from Osaka Station depart in the following order: Special Rapid Service, Rapid Service (letting the connecting Special Rapid Service pass at Osaka Station) and Local Train (from Koshienguchi Station to Kyoto Station), Local Train (from Nishi-Akashi Station to Suita Station).

sen.j: 吹田・甲子園口発着に系統分割されたのは、普通を西明石→京都間通し運転すると当時内側線を共用していた新快速から逃げ切れなくなるためである。
sen.e: The local trains were divided into two routes; departure/arrival at Suita Station and at Koshien-guchi Station, because if all the trains were to straightly run between Nishiakashi Station and Kyoto Station, they would not be able to escape from Shinkansen running on the inbound line, which was a shared lane at that time.

The local trains were divided into two routes: departure/arrival at Suita Station and at Koshien-guchi Station, because if all the trains were to run straight between Nishiakashi Station and Kyoto Station they would be unable to escape from the Shinkansen running on the inbound line, which was a shared lane at that time.

The local trains were divided into two routes: departure/arrival at Suita Station and at Koshienguchi Station, because if all the trains were to run straight between Nishi-Akashi Station and Kyoto Station they would be unable to escape from the special rapid running on the inner line, which was at that time a shared lane.

sen.j: 結果、京都～岸辺間は15分おきに普通電車が来る形になった。
sen.e: As a result, the local train was arranged to pass every 15 minutes in the section between Kyoto Station and Kishibe Station.
As a result, the local train was arranged to pass every 15 minutes in the section between Kyoto Station and Kishibe Station.
As a result, the local train was arranged to pass every 15 minutes in the section between Kyoto Station and Kishibe Station.

sen.j: 1985年3月に昼間の快速が京都～高槻間各駅停車となり、昼間の運転区間は高槻以西となる。
sen.e: In March, 1985, the special rapid running during the daytime began making a stop at all stations between Kyoto and Takatsuki, and therefore, during the daytime, the rapid became only available from Takatsuki Station and to the west.

In March 1985, the special rapid running during the daytime began making stops at all stations between Kyoto and Takatsuki, and therefore, during the daytime, the rapid became available only from Takatsuki Station and to the west.

In March 1985, the rapid service running during the daytime began making stops at all stations between Kyoto and Takatsuki; consequently, during the daytime the rapid service became available only from Takatsuki Station and to the west.

sen.j: また、普通電車への国鉄201系電車車両投入によりスピードアップが図られ、新快速を各待避駅まで逃げ切れるようになり、高槻～西明石と吹田～甲子園口の運転パターンになる。
sen.e: The introduction of JNR/JR Commuter Trains Series 201achieved a speed up of the local trains and made them possible to reach one of the shunting stations to let Shinkansen pass without being caught.
sen.cmt: 国鉄201系→JNR/JR Commuter Trains Series 201(http://www.uraken.net/rail/alltrain/uratetsu201.html参照）、待避駅→shunting station（小学館プ）
sen.e: The introduction of the JNR/JR Commuter Trains Series 201 effectively sped up the local trains and allowed them to reach one of the shunting stations to let Shinkansen pass without being caught.

The introduction of the JNR/JR Commuter Train Series 201 effectively sped up the local trains and allowed them to reach one of the shunting stations to let special rapid service trains pass without being caught, thereby offering services between Takatsuki and Nishi-Akashi and between Suita and Koshienguchi.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペース削除shinkansen →special rapid service高槻～神戸となり 以降の訳を追加しました。

sen.j: 1986年11月改正で、新快速が外側線へ移行し、高槻～西明石・高槻～神戸となり、高槻～岸辺間も15分に2本と増発された。
sen.e: With the revision made in November, 1986, the track of the special ｒaped was changed to the outbound line, and not only it started running between Takatsuki and Nishi-Akashi/Takatsuki and Kobe, but also it enhanced the service between Takaktsuki and Kishibe offering two trains in every 15 minutes.

With the revision made in November 1986, the track of the special ｒaped was changed to the outbound line, and not only it started running between Takatsuki and Nishi-Akashi/Takatsuki and Kobe, but also it enhanced the service between Takaktsuki and Kishibe offering two trains in every 15 minutes.

With the revision of November 1986, the track of the special ｒapid servie was changed to run on the outer line, and not only it started running between Takatsuki and Nishi-Akashi/Takatsuki and Kobe, but also it enhanced the service between Takatsuki and Kishibe by offering two trains every 15 minutes.
sen.cmt: rapidに修正 Takaktsuki →Takatsuki 外側線→outer line

sen.j: 京都駅ビル開業の1997年9月改正で、駅ビルへの集客を見込み高槻～神戸系統を京都～高槻間延長し、京都線内の各駅とも15分に2本利用できる形が定着した。
sen.e: In September, 1997, with the opening of Kyoto Station Building, the revision was made based on the possible increase of passengers, and the Takatsuki-Kobe route, which was extended to cover the section between Kyoto and Takatsuki, enabled the passengers to use two trains in 15 minutes at every station on the Kyoto Line.
sen.cmt: 高槻～神戸系統→定訳不明：the Takatsuki-Kobe routeとしました。
sen.e: In September 1997, with the opening of the Kyoto Station building, the revision was made based on the possible increase of passengers, and the Takatsuki-Kobe route--which was extended to cover the section between Kyoto and Takatsuki--allowed passengers to use two trains in 15 minutes at every station on the Kyoto Line.

sen.j: また、高槻～西明石間の系統が高槻～JR宝塚線新三田間の運転に変更されている。

sen.j: 現在は昼間のパターンが夜間まで拡大され、京都～西明石間（昼間の一部は須磨駅まで）とJR宝塚線直通の高槻～新三田間の各系統が15分おきに運転されている。
sen.e: At present, the daytime pattern is applied to the night operation and a train runs every 15 minutes on the route between Kyoto and Nishi-Akashi (during the daytime some trains only go as far as Suma Station) as well as the route between Takatsuki and Shin-Sanda which connects directly with theJR Takarazuka Line.

tit.cmt: 貨物列車→freight train（小学館プ）

sen.j: 茨木～千里丘間に分岐（現在は茨木駅構内に含まれる）があり、貨物列車はここから貨物線を吹田信号所へと向かう。

sen.j: 東海道線～山陽線の直通貨物列車は、吹田信号場～宮原操車場（1998年に宮原総合運転所に統合）～尼崎駅 (JR西日本)間の通称北方貨物線を経由し、大阪駅は通らない。
sen.e: The through freight train running between the Tokai Line and the Sanyo Line goes on the line known as the "Hoppo Freight Line", via Suita Signal Ground, Miyahara Switching Yard (integrated into the Miyahara General Operation Office in 1998) and JR West Amagasaki Station, and it does not pass Osaka Station.
sen.cmt: 操車場→switching yard、総合運転所→general operation officeとしました。 (ともに、英辞郎WEB）、北方貨物線→Hoppo Freight Line （用語リスト＃1353参照）
sen.e: The through freight train running between the Tokai Line and the Sanyo Line goes on the line known as the "Hoppo Freight Line" via Suita Signal Ground, Miyahara Switching Yard (which was integrated into the Miyahara General Operation Office in 1998) and JR West Amagasaki Station, but it does not pass Osaka Station.

The through freight train running between the Tokaido Line and the Sanyo Line takes the line known as the Hoppo Freight Line via Suita signal station, Miyahara Switching Yard (which was integrated into the Miyahara General Operation Office in 1998) and JR West Amagasaki Station, but it does not pass Osaka Station.
sen.cmt: Tokai Line →Tokaido Line 吹田信号場 → Suita Signal Station

sen.j: 桜島線安治川口への貨物列車は吹田信号場から梅田貨物駅を通り、環状線西九条駅への梅田貨物線を通る。
sen.e: The freight train for Ajigawa-guchi Station on the Sakurajima Line goes through Suita Signal Ground and Umeda Freight Station, and proceed on the Umeda Freight Line that leads to Nishi-Kujo Station of the Kanjo Line (Kanjo belt line).
sen.cmt: 梅田貨物駅、梅田貨物線→Umeda freight station, Umeda freight line (英辞郎WEB、用語リスト＃1353参照）、環状線→KanjoLine (Kanjo belt line) としました。（英辞郎WEB参照）
sen.e: The freight train for Ajigawa-guchi Station on the Sakurajima Line goes through Suita Signal Ground and Umeda Freight Station, then proceeds on the Umeda Freight Line that leads to Nishi-Kujo Station of the Kanjo Line (Kanjo belt line).

The freight train for Ajigawa-guchi Station on the Sakurajima Line goes through Suita signal station and Umeda Freight Station, then proceeds on the Umeda Freight Line that leads to Nishi-Kujo Station of the Osaka Loop Line.

sen.e: The trains heading for the direction of Nanki/the Kansai （International） Airport take a route that incorporates into the Kanjo Line (Kanjo belt line) through the Suita Signal Ground and the Umeda Freight Line.

sen.j: また、京都山陰線ホーム（30番はるかホームなど）からの下り列車は梅小路貨物駅構内を通り、通称はるかルートなどと書かれる場合もある。
sen.e: And down trains that start from the platforms of Kyoto San'in Line (Platform No. 30 for "Haruka," etc.) go passing through the Umekoji Freight Yard, therefore this route is sometimes called "Haruka (far-way) route."

sen.e: Additionally, down trains that start from the platforms of Kyoto San'in Line (Platform No. 30 for "Haruka," etc.) pass through the Umekoji Freight Yard, and consequently this route is sometimes called "Haruka (far-way) route."

Additionally, outbound trains that start from the platforms of Kyoto Sanin Line (Platform No. 30 for Haruka, etc.) pass through the Umekoji Freight Station, and consequently this route is sometimes called the Haruka (faraway) route.

sen.j: このほか、梅小路駅構内から直接山陰本線（嵯峨野線）丹波口駅間の短絡線を利用して一時期神戸・大阪から嵯峨嵐山への直通臨時列車が走ったことがあるが、誤乗が多かったことなどから定着しなかった。
sen.e: At one time, a special direct ｔrain was operated to Saga-Arashiyama Station from Kobe and Osaka, making use of a bypass lane which proceeds directly to the Tanbaguchi Station section of the San'in Main Line (Sagano Line) from the Umekoji Station Yard, but it has not been fixed because of some inconvenience such as many passengers happened to take the train by error.
sen.cmt: 短絡線→定訳不明：bypass laneとしました。臨時列車→special train (小学館プ・英辞郎WEB）、直接臨時列車→定訳不明：special through trainとしました。（小学館プ・英辞郎WEB参考）
sen.e: At one time a special direct train was operated to Saga-Arashiyama Station from Kobe and Osaka, making use of a bypass lane that proceeded directly to the Tanbaguchi Station section of the San'in Main Line (Sagano Line) from the Umekoji Station Yard, but it has not been fixed due to inconveniences such as the fact that many passengers had happened to take the train by error.

At one time a special direct train was operated to Saga-Arashiyama Station from Kobe and Osaka, making use of a bypass lane that proceeded directly to the Tanbaguchi Station of the Sanin Main Line (Sagano Line) from the Umekoji Station Yard, but it has not been fixed due to inconveniences such as the fact that many passengers had happened to take the train by mistake.
